Jurgen Klopp is set to be without some key names going into the first game of the Premier League season.

Jordan Henderson, Trent Alexander-Arnold and Simon Mignolet all participated in the World Cup semi-finals, which therefore means the three will almost get three weeks off.

Dejan Lovren will also receive the same amount of time off as well as he played in the World Cup final representing Croatia.

They will all resume training seven days before the Premier League opener at home to West Ham United on August 12.
